trans-unit.source: There are a couple of different ways to install the modules: the PowerShell Gallery and the Web Platform Installer.
trans-unit.target: There are a couple of different ways to install the modules: the PowerShell Gallery and the Web Platform Installer.

trans-unit.source: The end result is pretty much the same, although the way you select to do your install will determine where the modules are installed by default on your computer.
trans-unit.target: The end result is pretty much the same, although the way you select to do your install will determine where the modules are installed by default on your computer.

trans-unit.source: When you install from the PowerShell Gallery, your files will be located by default in *%ProgramFiles%\WindowsPowerShell\Modules*.
trans-unit.target: When you install from the PowerShell Gallery, your files will be located by default in *%ProgramFiles%\WindowsPowerShell\Modules*.

trans-unit.source: When you install from the Web Platform Installer, your files will be located by default in *%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SDKs\Azure\PowerShell\*.
trans-unit.target: When you install from the Web Platform Installer, your files will be located by default in *%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SDKs\Azure\PowerShell\*.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, you'll want to stick with one or the other in order to avoid errors when you update your cmdlets in the future.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, you'll want to stick with one or the other in order to avoid errors when you update your cmdlets in the future.

trans-unit.source: The Web Platform Installer will receive updated cmdlets monthly.
trans-unit.target: The Web Platform Installer will receive updated cmdlets monthly.

trans-unit.source: The Gallery receives updated versions of the cmdlets at the time they are released.
trans-unit.target: The Gallery receives updated versions of the cmdlets at the time they are released.

trans-unit.source: For that reason, some people prefer to use the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: For that reason, some people prefer to use the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: For additional information about installing Azure PowerShell, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For additional information about installing Azure PowerShell, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: To install modules from the PowerShell Gallery
trans-unit.target: To install modules from the PowerShell Gallery

trans-unit.source: To install the Resource Manager module directly from the Gallery, open Windows PowerShell as administrator and type the following:
trans-unit.target: To install the Resource Manager module directly from the Gallery, open Windows PowerShell as administrator and type the following:

trans-unit.source: Once you have installed the modules, you'll need to import them in order to use them:
trans-unit.target: Once you have installed the modules, you'll need to import them in order to use them:

trans-unit.source: To install modules using the Web Platform Installer
trans-unit.target: To install modules using the Web Platform Installer

trans-unit.source: You can install modules using the [Web Platform Installer](http://aka.ms/webpi-azps).
trans-unit.target: You can install modules using the [Web Platform Installer](http://aka.ms/webpi-azps).

trans-unit.source: When you click the link, it will launch the installer.
trans-unit.target: When you click the link, it will launch the installer.

trans-unit.source: If you get errors when using the Web Platform Installer, it may be because you have already installed a previous version of the cmdlets using the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: If you get errors when using the Web Platform Installer, it may be because you have already installed a previous version of the cmdlets using the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: See this [Blog Post](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azps-1-0/), which can help you remove older versions of the modules and get you back up and running.
trans-unit.target: See this [Blog Post](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azps-1-0/), which can help you remove older versions of the modules and get you back up and running.

trans-unit.source: Typically errors result when you have used the Web Platform Installer and are switching to the Gallery, or the other way around.
trans-unit.target: Typically errors result when you have used the Web Platform Installer and are switching to the Gallery, or the other way around.

trans-unit.source: Removing the modules that were installed earlier clears this issue, and you can then install from the new location.
trans-unit.target: Removing the modules that were installed earlier clears this issue, and you can then install from the new location.
